section.title: Roles
section.para: The cluster defines several roles, each with their own purpose and privileges. Roles are created by the cluster setup script. Privileges are granted by migration scripts.

glossdef.para: The cluster superuser. Used for tasks that need superuser privileges or privileges not granted to other roles. While other roles are created by the cluster setup script, this role is created by initdb. This role is used mainly by the cluster setup script.
The application role, used by sitrep-receive and other server-side applications. This role cannot modify the database schema. This role can read and write rows, and is subject to row-level security.

The migration role, used by the migration scripts. This role can modify the schema and grant privileges. Because of its potential need to modify data en masse, this role is not subject to row-level security.

section.section: Authentication Password authentication is used for all roles in all environments. In the development environment, the password for each role is equivalent to the name of the role.
